content.question: The diagrams above represent two allotropes of solid phosphorus. Which of the following correctly identifies the allotrope with the higher melting point and explains why?

choices.label: Allotrope <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has <math alttext="P 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules with covalent bonds that are stronger than dispersion forces between individual <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in allotrope <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Allotrope <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has covalent bonds between the phosphorous atoms that are stronger than the dispersion forces between the <math alttext="P 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in allotrope <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Allotrope <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has metallic bonding that is stronger than the covalent bonding found in the <math alttext="P 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in allotrope <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Both allotropes have the same melting point because they both contain phosphorous atoms.

content.answer: Allotrope <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it has covalent bonds between the phosphorous atoms that are stronger than the dispersion forces between the <math alttext="P 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in allotrope <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
